TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed NumberSubstitutionMethod extends System.Enum

summary.span: 定义一个枚举类，该枚举类指定对文本运行中的数字执行的数字替换的类型。

span.span: Defines an enumerator class that specifies the type of number substitution to perform on numbers in a text run.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 大多数区域性中使用十进制来表示数字，但是许多区域性使用不同的数字形状。Most cultures use the decimal system to represent numbers, but many cultures use different digit shapes. 下表显示几种不同的区域性使用的编号方案。The following table shows several numbering systems used by different cultures. ![数字备用标志符号表](~/add/media/numbersubstitution01.png "数字备用标志符号表")![Table of number substitution glyphs](~/add/media/numbersubstitution01.png "Table of number substitution glyphs") 不同区域性中的数字的外观的示例Example of the appearance of digits in different cultures 它不满足需求的数字形状，每组提供替代的 Unicode 码位，因为与不同的是字母、 数字计算中使用。It is not sufficient to provide alternate Unicode code points for each set of digit shapes, because, unlike letters, digits are used in calculations. 每个应用程序、 每个操作系统，以及每个运行时库都包含代码专门用于将内部二进制格式的数字值转换为字符串，反之亦然。Every application, every operating system, and every run-time library contains code dedicated to converting an internal binary format numeric value to a string of characters, and vice versa. 这些转换例程编码为使用 Unicode 数字"0030"通过"0039"。These conversion routines are coded to use Unicode digits "0030" through "0039". 类提供允许要在呈现时替换相应的数字形状的不同区域性的功能。The class provides functionality that allows different cultures to substitute the appropriate digit shapes at rendering time. 此功能是类似于用于提供字体替换和呈现语言相关字体。This functionality is similar to the one used for providing font substitution and language dependent font rendering. > [!NOTE] > 许多区域性正在放弃其传统的数字形状并采用西方数字形状，因此，数字替换功能识别为每个区域性传统数字形状和国际标准数字形状之间的区别。Many cultures are discarding their traditional digits shapes and adopting Western digits shapes, therefore the number substitution functionality recognizes the distinction for each culture between traditional digit shapes and national standard digit shapes.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitutionMethod AsCulture = int32(0)

summary.span: 指定应该根据数字区域性的 属性值来确定替换方法。

span.span: Specifies that the substitution method should be determined based on the number culture's property value.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitutionMethod Context = int32(1)

summary.span: 如果数字区域性为阿拉伯语或波斯语区域性，则指定数字取决于上下文。

span.span: If the number culture is an Arabic or Farsi culture, specifies that the digits depend on the context.

summary.span: 根据紧靠在前面的强字符（如果没有，则根据段落的文本方向）来使用传统数字或拉丁数字。

span.span: Either traditional or Latin digits are used depending on the nearest preceding strong character, or, if there is none, the text direction of the paragraph.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitutionMethod European = int32(2)

summary.span: 指定将码位 0x30-0x39 始终呈现为欧洲数字，在这种情况下，不需要执行数字替换。

span.span: Specifies that code points 0x30-0x39 are always rendered as European digits, in which case, no number substitution is performed.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitutionMethod NativeNational = int32(3)

summary.span: 指定使用由区域性的 属性值所指定的数字区域性民族数字来呈现数字。

span.span: Specifies that numbers are rendered using the national digits for the number culture, as specified by the culture's property value.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitutionMethod Traditional = int32(4)

summary.span: 指定使用数字区域性民族数字来呈现数字。

span.span: Specifies that numbers are rendered using the traditional digits for the number culture.

summary.span: 对于大多数区域性，这与 枚举值相同。

span.span: For most cultures, this is the same as the enumeration value.

summary.span: 但是，使用 可以让某些阿拉伯语区域性产生拉丁数字，而使用 可让所有阿拉伯语区域性产生阿拉伯数字。

span.span: However, using can result in Latin digits for some Arabic cultures, whereas using results in Arabic digits for all Arabic cultures.
